venue.address_2: Off of Beacon Street - landmarks State House & Fox TV
venue.name: 21st Amendment

item.description:
The US Constitution repealed the Eighteenth Amendment, which mandated nationwide Prohibition. Long story short Congress eventually proposed the Twenty-first Amendment which was passed for the explicit and nearly sole purpose of repealing an earlier amendment to the Constitution. The short and sweet story: The 21st amendment ended national prohibition.

To celebrate a little bit of American History let's raise a glass and have some great pub food in one of the best pubs in town where rumor has it that JFK drafted his speeches by the fireplace in the back. A block from the State House, it is easy to get to, has friendly waitstaff and a great menu. I hope you can join me!
item.how_to_find_us: I will send out my cell #, but we'll be seated in the back room.

group.name: Brunch & More (20/30-Somethings for brunch & more, etc...)

item.name: The 21st Amendment - a bar full of history
